metadata.synopsis: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
metadata.how_to_trigger:
Repro steps:
1. Start the game.
2. goto 111.751; 46.516; -89.8
3. 3. Talk with Blurg (To trigger the Mindflayer moments, tell him about your tadpole when he asks what you're doing in the Underdark)

39.speaker: Blurg
39.text: Welcome back. Have you made any new discoveries?

51.speaker: Blurg
51.text: Welcome back. Have you made any new discoveries?

85.speaker: Blurg
85.text: Ah, a visitor! You're a welcome sight.

20.speaker: Blurg
20.text: Ah... wait. You're not with that damned raiding party. Apologies.

130.speaker: Blurg
130.text: But let us observe the customs of the locals.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The scholar's brow tenses. His voice spills into your skull, the spores connecting mind to mind.*

47.speaker: Blurg
47.text: Blurg, proud member of the Society of Brilliance, at your service.

57.speaker: Blurg
57.text: Hgh--nzzt. Or perhaps not. Your mind is far more complex than that of the fungi.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I've never heard of the Society of Brilliance.

56.speaker: Blurg
56.text: Understandable. We are small in number, and rarely stay in one place for long.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Your kind tend to be slaves down here.

131.speaker: Blurg
131.text: It's true that many of my brethren are enslaved here, but my intellect has secured my freedom.

22.speaker: Blurg
22.text: It is my hope that my research will lead to liberation and peace for my people.

72.speaker: Blurg
72.text: Such designs are part of why I've devoted myself to studying the myconids.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I've never seen a hobgoblin like you before.

4.speaker: Blurg
4.text: The feeling is mutual, friend. I have only passing familiarity with the surface races.

77.speaker: Blurg
77.text: But I've found that there is as much to learn from an individual as there is from a community.

38.speaker: Blurg
38.text: So it is with the myconids: they live in harmonious unity, but each has a unique personality.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Research in the Underdark sounds like a dangerous prospect.

161.speaker: Blurg
161.text: Yes, but it has abundant natural resources. Spores, waterorbs, trillimac! I've studied them for years.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: *There is rare magic in the Underdark too. Faerzress. It radiates from the earth, warping teleportation and divination magic.*

156.text: *There is rare magic in the Underdark too. Faerzress. It radiates from the earth, warping teleportation and divination magic.*

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *There is rare magic in the Underdark too. Faerzress. It radiates from the earth, warping teleportation and divination magic.*

53.speaker: Blurg
53.text: This is not a wasteland: it is a glorious ecosystem. Every civilisation here could thrive without conflict!

6.speaker: Blurg
6.text: It's curious to find a githyanki here. What has brought you down so deep?

52.speaker: Blurg
52.text: It's curious to find a surface dweller here. What has brought you down so deep?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Honestly? I kind of got lost down here.

36.speaker: Blurg
36.text: A common phenomenon in the Underdark, I'm afraid.

34.speaker: Blurg
34.text: Could I ask what you were searching for to begin with?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I am trying to return to my people.

97.speaker: Blurg
97.text: You may have trouble reaching the Astral Plane from here, young gith.

160.speaker: Blurg
160.text: Why do you not seek refuge among your own on the surface?

11.speaker: Blurg
11.text: Our kind has suffered needlessly for generations. Do you also seek peace among the myconids?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: A mind flayer infected me with a tadpole.

19.speaker: Blurg
19.text: Truly remarkable! But why come to the Underdark, where they hold so much power?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You were infected by an illithid tadpole? It's a miracle you're still intact!

9.speaker: Blurg
9.text: You were infected by an illithid tadpole? It's a miracle you're still intact!

83.speaker: Blurg
83.text: You must be worried sick, but have no fear.

81.speaker: Blurg
81.text: I have a friend who may be able to assist.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I hope this is important, Blurg. My zurkhwood samples need constant attention.

65.speaker: Omeluum
65.text: I hope this is important, Blurg. My zurkhwood samples need constant attention.

62.speaker: Blurg
62.text: It is! This adventurer has an illithid tadpole inside their head. But they haven't turned.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[gameplay reuse] Omeluum arrives and hovers

164.speaker: Omeluum
164.text: No ceremorphosis? That's impossible! But intriguing.
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[gameplay reuse] Omeluum arrives and hovers

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Ghaik. Your head will make a fine trophy for my queen!

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: Ghaik. Your head will make a fine trophy for my queen!

63.speaker: Player
63.text: But I assure you, I stand with the Society of Brilliance, not the colonies of my people.

37.speaker: Omeluum
37.text: But I assure you, I stand with the Society of Brilliance, not the colonies of my people.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Stifle your revulsion and listen to the mind flayer.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I know what it's like to be shunned. I understand, Omeluum.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I've made a lot of strange allies for information. Let's hear it.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: The myconids wouldn't appreciate us fighting here. I'll listen.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: They infest your head and invade your dreams, and still you would parley?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I ask only that you refrain from violence. I respect that your opinion of my kind may be... charged.

102.speaker: Omeluum
102.text: I ask only that you refrain from violence. I respect that your opinion of my kind may be... charged.

91.speaker: Omeluum
91.text: If that settles matters for the time being... would you like a diagnosis?

86.speaker: Omeluum
86.text: Open your mind to me. Let us see what lurks within.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Swallow your disgust and permit the ghaik's search.

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *As Omeluum's mind pierces yours, the tadpole pulses with power.*

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *It feels ten times its size. Alive, awake. Almost smug.*

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Relax and let Omeluum's mind search your own.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

69.speaker: Omeluum
69.text: I see. I will remain here if you change your mind.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I want nothing to do with you.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'd never trust a mind flayer. Attack.

80.speaker: Omeluum
80.text: Are you looking to have it extracted?

31.speaker: Omeluum
31.text: Please, hold. I understand your rage against my kin.

141.speaker: Omeluum
141.text: My species devastated and enslaved yours. It is unforgivable.

124.speaker: Omeluum
124.text: One of my brethren forced a tadpole into your eye. Or ear, perhaps?

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I'd never trust a mind flayer. Attack.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You'll die choking on your own bile, ghaik!

103.speaker: Player
103.text: An illithid is your friend? How is that possible?

127.speaker: Omeluum
127.text: I have broken free from the elder brain's yoke. I no longer serve the Grand Design.

154.speaker: Omeluum
154.text: I ask that you refrain from violence, while I respect that your opinion of my kind may not change.

89.speaker: Omeluum
89.text: A collective quest to eliminate the gith and enslave all other humanoids.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I'm not refraining from anything. You'll die like the rest.

73.speaker: Blurg
73.text: Forgive me. Being inquisitive is in my nature.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: This is where I belong, but right now I can't stay.
23.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

132.speaker: Blurg
132.text: I know the feeling well. What has driven you from home?

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I collect mushrooms to sell on the surface.
107.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

136.speaker: Blurg
136.text: Then you've come to the right place. The hybridisation among fungi in this circle is truly unique.
136.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

5.speaker: Blurg
5.text: Then you've come to the right place. The hybridisation among fungi in this circle is truly unique.

144.text: I... see. A fine way to make a living.
144.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

155.speaker: Blurg
155.text: I... see. A fine way to make a living.
155.context: NodeContext: Brugh looks the player up and down, clearly skeptical.

40.speaker: Blurg
40.text: My colleagues and I are working to improve conditions in the Underdark. This need not be such a dire, hostile place.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Our peoples aren't exactly inclined to share with each other.

117.speaker: Blurg
117.text: And yet, we are all in need. Imagine what creativity would bloom if no craftsman starved. If every wizard had spell materials!

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Such is nature's balance: life thriving under adversity.

44.speaker: Blurg
44.text: Exactly! It's such a relief to meet another sensible mind.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Do you have anything interesting to trade?

129.speaker: Blurg
129.text: I do enjoy a good bargain, if anything in my private collection is to your liking.

135.speaker: Blurg
135.text: Very well. I have mushrooms to catalogue.

163.speaker: Blurg
163.text: Very well. I have mushrooms to catalogue.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Seems like you've had a run-in with my people before.

0.speaker: Blurg
0.text: You scoundrels attacked these peaceful villagers completely unprovoked! Filthy, dim-witted...

71.speaker: Blurg
71.text: Pardon. Sometimes my temper gets the better of me.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Were you here when the duergar attacked?

120.speaker: Blurg
120.text: I observed the fight from a distance. Combat is not my field of expertise, but the myconids handled themselves well enough.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Can you tell me more about ceremorphosis?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: *Omeluum's tentacles flutter in what appears to be the mind flayer's approximation of a smile.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Omeluum's tentacles flutter in what appears to be the mind flayer's approximation of a smile.*

148.speaker: Blurg
148.text: Excellent! Omeluum will be happy to answer all of your questions.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Do you know anything about ceremorphosis?

133.speaker: Blurg
133.text: A fascinating topic. May I ask the reason for your interest?

90.speaker: Player
90.text: We all have our unique interests. Mind flayers are mine.

48.speaker: Blurg
48.text: I see! Well, it is the central act of mind flayer reproduction.

140.speaker: Blurg
140.text: A tadpole is inserted into a living humanoid, and in seven days, the host is consumed to produce a new illithid.

116.speaker: Blurg
116.text: A fascinating process, if a touch grim.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Can I talk to Omeluum again?

13.speaker: Blurg
13.text: Let me see if it will answer my summons a second time.

112.speaker: Blurg
112.text: Ah, the mushroom hunter! Have you made any new discoveries?

84.speaker: Blurg
84.text: Ah... wait. You're not with that damned raiding party. Apologies.

118.speaker: Blurg
118.text: Ah, a visitor! You're a welcome sight.

162.speaker: Blurg
162.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.
